sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {2, 3, 5, 7, 11} and B = {2, 3, 13, 17}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B and simplify your answer. Then find the intersection of the sets A and B. Show that the symmetric difference of A and B is not commutative with respect to intersection by comparing the result of (A △ B) ∩ B with the result of (B △ A) ∩ A.
